H0.text: who are the u s senators of pennsylvania. Bob Casey

H1.text: who are the u s senators of pennsylvania. Arlen Specter

H2.text: who are the u s senators of pennsylvania. Rick Santorum

H3.text: who are the u s senators of pennsylvania. Pat Toomey

A4.text: Robert Patrick Casey Jr. served from 2007 to 2025 as a United States senator from Pennsylvania.

A5.text: Casey defeated the Republican incumbent, Rick Santorum.

A6.text: Patrick Joseph Toomey Jr. served as a United States senator from Pennsylvania from 2011 to 2023.

A7.text: In 2004, Toomey challenged longtime incumbent Senator Arlen Specter in the Republican primary election.

A8.text: John Fetterman has served as a United States senator from Pennsylvania since 2023.

A9.text: Dave McCormick has served as a United States senator from Pennsylvania since 2025.

A10.text: The Connecticut Compromise provided, among other things, that each state—regardless of population—would be represented by two senators.

A11.text: Since 1913, following ratification of the Seventeenth Amendment senators have been elected by statewide popular vote.
